messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] good questions
messages.msgSnippet: They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary saftety deserve neither liberty nor safety.  Ben Franklin leschke@shaw.ca ... are ...
messages.messageBody:
"They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary
saftety deserve neither liberty nor safety." Ben Franklin
leschke@...
> <<
> You guys are really busy trying to school each other while your children
are
> benefitting from your distraction. Who can read all these emails and
still
> have time to be with the greatest treasure in the world? >>
>
> I think that is an incredibly rude assumption.

Besides which, a person who can't read the welcome message or scan to the
bottom of even one post to find out how to unsubscribe is not the best
candidate for an unschooling parent.
Tia

messages.subject: good questions
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/6/03 8:56:09 PM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/6/03 8:56:09 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<<
You guys are really busy trying to school each other while your children are
benefitting from your distraction. Who can read all these emails and still
have time to be with the greatest treasure in the world? >>

I think that is an incredibly rude assumption.
I get the emails in digest form and I can quickly scan through many posts in
a very short time and respond just as quickly.
At the moment, all of MY treasures are asleep. Blissfully, peacefully
sleeping. I have worked out, checked email and will be showered before they
are even up.
How rude to assume we would short our children in any way because we are here
trying to help other people have better lives.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett
